Deadlines directory
Some tasks may be limited in time during the business process (
BP
). To control the time limit for completing tasks, you need to specify the
deadlines
.
Deadlines
define rules to control time limits to complete tasks in the business process.
To set a deadline, you need to:
1. Select the following items in the navigation menu: WorkFlow → Deadlines. The System will display the
type registry "WorkFlow. Deadline"
.
2. Add a custom deadline by clicking the
button. The System will display a profile "WorkFlow. Deadline".
The visual profile of
any object type of the System
can be configured by the administrator independently (for more information, refer to
Configuring the visual
).
3. To specify deadlines, you need to set the following:
Specify the setting name
Specify the relations of this deadline with the object type in the context of which it will be applied (
the "Relations with object types" block of fields
)
Set the conditions that will be used to define how the deadline will be applied to the process (
the "Deadline countdown conditions" block of fields
)
Specify the time limit for sending notifications about the approach of the deadline (
the "Configuring notification sending" block of fields
)
These blocks are described below.
4. Save the data entered by clicking
or
in the custom object instance profile.
The deadline has been set.
To work with deadlines, actions are used (
both planned and actual time is taken into account
):
— The action recalculates information in the instance of
"WorkFlow. Deadline instance"
— Recalculation of deadline for the route object Recalculation of deadline is performed for a specific route object specified in the settings. Recalculation of deadlines is performed for the object types (associated with the route object specified):
"
WorkFlow. Deadline instance
"
"
WorkFlow. Deadline
"
The "Relations with object types" block of fields
The
"Relations with object types"
block of fields binds the deadline settings to the object type. The same deadline may be applied to several object types at the same time.
To create a relation, click
button in the "
Relations with object types
"table. The System will display a form where you need to specify:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the relation of the deadline and the object type.
Deadline
Displaying the setting name (object type instance "WorkFlow. Deadline").
System object type directory
Selecting the object type from the drop-down list that you want to set up a deadline for.
Algorithm to define a relation with the parent object
Selecting an algorithm to define a relation with the predefined parent object. Learn more about
algorithms
. It is usually used to calculate the technical deadline for all related processes.
The "
Count as one deadline for all related processes
" option allows you to take into account the
technical deadline
, within which the working time spent on processes started by different BP instances and for different objects is calculated. Possible values:
Yes – time spent is calculated:
for the current object (the deadline for which is configured) and related objects that are identified by the
Algorithm to define the relation with the parent object
.
by the processes specified in the settings (the "
Deadline countdown conditions
" block of fields of the current profile).
No – the time spent is calculated within the process instance (used by default).
At the same time, taking into account the deadline for all related processes assumes that there are no calculations of parallel deadlines. If multiple BP instances are generated, a single deadline calculation will be carried out for all related processes. If the
Algorithm to define the relation with the parent object
operated with an error or failed, the deadline is not calculated.
The "Deadline" and "Configuring notification sending" blocks of fields
The
"Deadline"
and
"Configuring notification sending"
options contain the following fields:
Deadline type / Type of notification period
Select the deadline type / type of notification period from the directory.
Possible values:
Calculated deadline in minutes – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number that the algorithm returns (the "Algorithm for calculated deadline" attribute) will be equal to the number of minutes.
Calculated deadline in hours – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number that the algorithm returns (the "Algorithm for calculated deadline" attribute) will be equal to the number of hours.
Calculated deadline in days – calculated without reference to calendars or business days. The number that the algorithm returns (the "Algorithm for calculated deadline" attribute) will be equal to the number of days.
Calculated deadline in business days – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number that the algorithm returns (the "Algorithm for calculated deadline" attribute) will be equal to the number of business days.
When selecting calculated types, select a pre-defined algorithm in the "Algorithm for calculated deadline" field to define the final value of the deadline.
Fixed deadline in minutes – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number specified in the "Due date" field will be equal to the number of minutes.
Fixed deadline in hours – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number specified in the "Due date" field will be equal to the number of hours.
Fixed deadline in days – calculated without reference to calendars and working hours. The number specified in the "Due date" field will be equal to the number of days.
Fixed deadline in working hours – calculated based on the calendar settings and working hours. The number specified in the "Due date" field will be equal to the number of business days.
If you select this type, you need to enter a value for the deadline in the "Due date" field.
Setting
Purpose
Due date/Notification period
Enter the number of time units for a fixed definition of the deadline.
Calculated period algorithm
Choose the pre-defined algorithm in case of setting the calculated deadline. Learn more about
algorithms
.
Algorithm to calculate the notification period
Choose the pre-defined algorithm to calculate the period of sending the notification. Learn more about
algorithms
.
Technical deadline
Specify a boolean attribute that defines the purpose of the deadline. Possible options:
No – the deadline is configured for users and will be calculated based on related objects; however, you can configure notifications for the user about the approach and delay of the deadline. This is a default value.
Yes – the deadline is set for technical purposes (for example, for reporting or routes monitoring). In this configuration, fixed deadlines are not set, notifications about the approach or end of the deadline are not sent.
Object type to be initiated
Specify the object type of the deadline instance created. At the same time:
This field specifies the type
"WorkFlow. Deadline instance" [WF_NORMATIVE_INSTANCE]
or its child types.
If this field is not filled in, a deadline instance will be created using the type
"WorkFlow. Deadline instance"
[WF_NORMATIVE_INSTANCE].
The technical deadline_ sets the time for completing a task so that data can be displayed in reports. The System functions to work with such deadlines are limited. The technical deadline does not fix the deadline for completing the task. Therefore, when searching for a deadline to suspend/resume, only non-technical deadlines are calculated.
The "Deadline countdown conditions" block of fields
The
"Deadline countdown conditions"
block of fields contains the following subgroups of defined data:
Processes
– select the business process (s) (BP) that will start the deadline for task completion for the object. The BP execution time is the end of the deadline. If you need to exclude the time spent for some specific BP stages from the deadline, specify these stages in the table "Process stage to exclude" of the Stages block;
Stages (stages of the business process) – select the stage(s) at which the deadline will/will not be counted
The specified setting will be transmitted to the corresponding BP stage (
Task
, "Due date" field);
Access groups – select a user group/role to specify the deadline. In this case, the deadline will apply to all BP stages where this user group/role is specified as responsible;
Statuses.
When working with BP stages and/or access groups, you need to specify the business processes that use these stages and access groups in setting up the deadline calculation conditions.
